summary: Jeremy Ray Akers is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His name appears on multiple payroll certifications for the committee during the period from February 1977 to December 1977. The documents list his name, social security number, and salary, confirming his employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. The documents indicate he was employed for the majority, if not the entirety, of the HSCA's active investigative period.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Jeremy Ray Akers' significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his role isn't detailed in these payroll documents, his presence on the committee's payroll indicates his involvement in the HSCA's efforts to investigate the assassination.
